148529611.review:
[h1] Story [/h1] (7/10)
The story of this game is difficult to understand. It seems like games made by Tamsoft don't really prioritize interesting story aspects. The story of this game starts with Famitsu and Dengekiko who want to make exclusive interviews with CPUs and their candidates. From here I still understand the story scheme. But what does creating a magazine news article have to do with killing monsters? okay in several aspects of the story, such as wanting to make news about how the CPU is united with its candidate by killing monsters together. But what was even stranger was when the final boss appeared, out of nowhere this creature suddenly wanted to destroy the game industry. It seems like Tamsoft has to change a lot of the story of the game it makes, to make it more logical and easier to understand.


[h1] Graphic [/h1] (8/10)
Even though the story is strange, the game's graphics are undeniably beautiful. I don't get bored seeing Neptune and his friends, even with custom costumes it becomes more interesting to look at and collect. Here, Tamsoft has been good at designing everything from the main character, side characters to the boss. no doubt netuneverse is the best.


[h1] Gameplay [/h1] (8/10)
The gameplay of this game...reminds me of a game. action game full of many skills. action game using block and evade strategies. However, the most typical aspect of the gameplay that I feel is very similar to that game is the scene where clothes are torn when they receive damage. Yes, you are right, what I meant was the Senran Kagura series game. It turns out that the developer of this game is the same as the developer of the Senran Kagura series, Tamsoft. No wonder it feels familiar to see the gameplay.


[h1] Sound [/h1] (8/10)
This time Tamsoft was very good at processing the sound effects of this game. I give it a thumbs up because on average the soundtrack they make is really unique and gives a new flavor to every Neptunia game. Because Idea Factory likes to use the same sound in every Neptunia game series, sometimes we get a little bored, and Tamsoft handles that problem very well. good job Tamsoft.

[h1] DLC [/h1] (7/10)
Because this is a spin off game, there isn't much DLC in this game, so I can't really comment much.

139287869.review:
Es un juego bastante entretenido si te gusta el género Musou popularizado entre otros por Dinasty Warriors. 

Propiamente la historia es una excusa para utilizar a todos los personajes mientras Dengekiko y Famitsu (ambas revistas japonesas) realizan un reportaje mientras completan misiones consistentes en el 90% de los casos en vencer a jefes -en este caso personajes con atributos fuertes.  En el segundo capítulo añade pequeños puzzles para completar algunas misiones que da diversidad al juego.

La diversión acaba cuando ves que de los 12 personajes al menos 5 reducen la dificultad al mínimo (Vert/Ram/Rom/Neptunia/Famitsu), al igual que el uso de trampas al superar ciertas hazañas. El contenido después del juego es lo más tedioso que puedas encontrarte: 

- Torneo entre todos los personajes del juego...y un doogo. El nivel fácil es muy fácil y el normal es difícil; el díficil es morir de un sólo golpe. Divertido la primera que juegas: aburrido en las siguientes.

. Torre Neptral: En cada planta tienes que vencer a diferentes enemigos hasta llegar al piso 50 donde tienes que luchar de nuevo contra el jefe final, cuya única diferencia es duplicar o triplicar la barra de vida. El juego espera que lo hagas con todos los personajes y cada uno tiene que completar cada piso. La parte positiva es que sirve para acumular medallas y lily ranks para los trofeos del juego.

139262526.review:
The goods
The combat has a a lot of spectacle. You'll have plenty of fun if you're a musou fan.
Funny dialogue and with a decent English dub.
COSTUME BREAKS

The bads
The camera is your worst enemy
No lock-on in combat makes aiming certain attacks very frustrating 
The PC controls aren't very good (plug in your controller if you value your sanity)
Little map/enemy variety
IRREGULAR QUESTS, SUCK!

In conclusion
For its flaws, it is fun time waster even for new comers to the series.

138015813.review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

137846609.review:
I'm not very familiar with Neptunia Series, but I played Senran kagura before, which they are same Publisher/Developer, I guess?
And there's a crossover between them called "Neptunia X Senran Kagura", I think, so it happens in the same universe? CMIIW.
I saw the game price is really cheap, & the most important thing, it has only 2 DLCs.
(I did research on other Neptunia games & their DLCs, and this one is not too much DLC).
It's gonna be short experience I think, & worth the money.

Pros :
~~~~~~~
+ Good soundtracks, very MOOD BOOSTER.
  Good thing is all unlocked in the beggining, you can listen them all anytime you want, play your favourite tracks, no need to spend your "in-game money" to buy them!
  (Doesn't like another "Anime-Based game" does).
  Unfortunately, you can't sort them out, making playlist of your favorite tracks only, but that's okay, nothing's perfect.

+ Good voice acts, whoever the voice actressess are, they really did a good job.
  I loved it, especially when they says, "Now Loading..."
  The default (audio) language is in English, so if you're into "Japanese anime stuff', I suggest you change the language to Japanese, much better!

+ Low specs gaming for 2016's game!
  I'm casual gamer, with my own Potato PC.
  Playing this game, I'm so grateful, I'm feel so refreshed.
  Not 2K-4K game, not 32GB RAM-game, not so-many-cpu-cores-game, no need updated CPU, no need updated graphic cards, no need to throw your old PC out to the window.

+ It's really fun game, addictive, it's very easy to farm EXP, grinding EXP is not to difficult.
  It takes some efforts, of course. But it's really worth it.
  You replay some mission, and the enemy's level is below you, it's still worth good exp.

+ Small game size, with only 2 DLCs, about 3GB, I guess.
  It's gonna be short experience, didn't take much time to beat it.
  But it can be long, hundred hours perhaps, if you're completionist, and want to get all the achievements.


Cons :
~~~~~~~
- Only the story have full subtitles/cc, the other sections are not (when you play the game, in battlefield/arena whatever, mostly characters are talking 'something')
  I'm not Japanese nor English, I can't focus on hearings sometimes, but can focus on my eyes reading text on the display.

- Prologue/Intro, whatever it is, is taking too long! (If you play new game)
  Took around 25-45 minutes I guess? It depends if we skipping (spamming mouse click or A on controller) the dialogue or not, and depends on how good are you on your controller.
  (How fast are you beat first 2 missions in the beggining).
  The Story Intro can't be skipped, neither the dialogue scene, can't pause the game while in 'visual story mode'/dialogue. 
  We can only spamming mouse button or mashing A button on controller to make it fast.
  This game has only manual save feature, so no auto-save, no checkpoint.
  If you choose new game, in the middle you exit the game, your progress won't be saved!
  The prologue needs to be cleared first! Which contains some dialogue readings & first 2 mission.
  And then, voila! some opening intro scene with song (which is always there everytime you open the game), and the quest menu!
  In quest/dungeon menu, you can save your progress, listening tracks, set up character, etc.
  IT IS NOT A BAD THING, really, but the duration needs to be shorter than before, just 1 mission at first, perhaps? 
  Need to quickly save my progress, and usually enjoyed the rest of the game at last, after I'm done with other things. (Kinda my habit)
  So first time i run the game it's just a gameplay testing around 7 minutes, setting up configs, options, if there's any techical issue or something.

- Like I said before, the save feature is really crucial.
  You need to save your progress regularly, because some achievements are misable! (if you're achievement hunter, you would understand)
  It's a GOOD THING there's no auto-save/checkpoint. 
  Just in case, make some different save in another slot save, each chapter.
  SOME ACHIEVEMENTS ARE REALLY PAIN IN THE A$$, that's my point!

- I know this is not 'Hentai Game', but 'Ecchi' in this game is not... quite spectacular. Y'know what I mean?
  I played Senran Kagura before, it's quite good. The "Costume break" thing, the "touched the girls" thing, etc.
  If you buy DLC, and activated it in DLC options "Swimsuit", and your character wear this swimsuit, there won't be "Costume Break event", what the heck?
  COstume break event is happened when your default character's suit torn apart, well it's not "fully torn apart", no differences, I still can't see... they... nevermind.
  Maybe because main theme of this game is "Anime girl" "Anime cute" "Cute monster not so scary at all"? 
  Perhaps some of the characters are not 18 yet?

- Buff items (replenish health kit) only spawn if we killed the enemies.
  And mostly enemies will drop items if they killed by our special attack, not regular attack.
  So, no crate contains item to break, no vase to break.
  For hardcore gamers, it's really challenging, but I'm only casual, remember?
  Good thing there are "accessory buff" that we can wear, right before we doing mission, preparation is everything.

- Support Mouse & controller, and we can use them in the same time, but not support keyboard?
  If your controller has Turbo function, use it.
  You will know why.

- So, in Story Mode > New Game, There are 2 options : CPUs story, Candidates Story.
  I'm playing both of them, in different save slot, and can't really tell the differences, nothing significant quite yet. 
  (except the order of appearance of the mission).
  There are 10 girls in this game, each grouped by 3 categories : CPU, Candidate, Reporter. (I think)
  so what is the difference anyway? the ending?
  then why we need 2 story mode, I think just 1 is enough, because the plot of the story is just the same anyway.

135041730.review:
Yes with conditions. 

- Don't expect much entertainment compare to mainline games. The whole game seems like it would take place within 2 OVA of a TV series. I won't say if I would rather watched that because It only took 8 hours to clear which set you at 85% story completion. The other 15% are *bonus* that took place after clearing the main story, and also the 15% not really worth exploring unless you're not comfortable looking at 85% clear rate.

- It's Voiced acted as per usual and I do enjoyed the Voice acting.

- Feels like it could take place between mainline games despite being a spin-off.

- The Game play is alright. It feels like a 2000 game but I've no further arguments regarding it.

Now for some other conditions you have to endure before the game would work with you.

- As per usual This is a port like Dark Souls or maybe generally Fromsoft games The Keys are controller buttons like X,Y,A,B. You have to when you 1st boot up the game, figure out which button does what on a KEYBOARD. Go into the configuration and RE-MAP everything into what you prefer.

- If you wish to 100% the story mission, you are gonna have to Cheat(part of the game optional toggle)  because the last 2 mission are IMPOSSIBLE to beat. The one with Neptune with Dengekiko and Uni with Blanc. The room is litter with BOSSES with annoying long range attack. 

- Heard of All X are equals? Well no that doesn't apply here as some do really better then others. Black Heart Y attack does a lot of damage it's a no brainer to spam it. The TWINS/White Sisters while I'm amazed doesn't attack exactly the same way as each other, both are super good at doing their job clearing mobs after mobs, TOO GOOD at it. The worst one to use against multiple fast attacking enemies would be Blanc, next to Green Heart.

Ok the camera angle is strange, but otherwise I don't get how the Vita version of this game only got average ratings at first. Neptunia Warriors with a clothes breaking mechanic? That's an incredible combination. And the fact the characters have not just ground but aerial combos makes moving around in this game feel really fun. I don't know why they didn't use similar physics in the other Neptunia games with action combat, it honestly feels really smooth in this game.

You have to use an external wrapper if your controller uses DInput rather than XInput, but that's not really a big deal, a silly reason to complain when there's so many of them available that you can get easily. Why that's the case considering the original version was on the PSVita and Playstation controllers use DInput on PC idk, but not really an issue.

119723243.review:
I Don't think i ever got this bored by playing a game, and im being serious

Never mind the fact that the game either softlocks on the loading screen, forcing me to Alt+F4 out of it, never mind the fact that the game crashes a lot, never mind the fact that the entire story is a cringe inducing Fanservice infested nightmare, even for Neptunia standards, never mind the fact that the game feels really fucking dated, never mind the fact that there is NO FUCKING AUTO-SAVE! and Never mind the fact that the Enemy AI is 90% Of the time really dumb, there is no difficulty in this game, nothing at all, this is a borefest, and im sorry, but i flat out refuse to pay 2 Euro for some shitty DLC to get all the achievements for the game, i flat out refuse to do that, i rather spend that 2 Euro on buying a bag of Chips, because at the very least i know i spent it on something that takes more than 15 minutes to eat, rather than spend it on a game that it takes less than 1 hour to beat and even then im being generous, why? because the game has what they call "cheats" to make an already easy game a cakewalk, for example, if you are masochistic enough to get all the items in the game, you get a No Damage cheat, making you literally unkillable, this is just bad game design, also, you see how i have 44 hours in the game? its because 20 of those hours were spent on fucking trouble shooting the game in the past whenever it crashed, which it did after literally every single fucking mission, and even when i got it in a semi-playable state, it was still a horrendous experience, the fact this game has a very positive rating is a slap in the face not just to any casual RPG fan but to the Neptunia fans themselves, they been begging for YEARS for a mainline game, yet we get literal asset flips between each Spin-Off because Idea Factory is too fucking lazy to make an actually good game, you know what was the last Good Neptunia game? This is a fairly good Neptunia spinoff. It's your basic hack n' slash, those kind where you're in one area and just kill a whole lot of monsters.

It would have been nice if there were more skills to use, and combos. There is very little diversity, but there are a lot of different characters, each with unique attacks, so that helps break up the monotony a bit. If you don't like repetitive games, then I would stay away from this. I personally don't mind them, and I didn't get bored until the end of the game.

The campaign has a stupid story, with the usual entirely too much talking that is prevalent in Neptunia games. Once you beat the story, you unlock some end game stuff to do, which is pretty boring, and without the story to motivate you, they are a bit of a chore.

Quests lack variety, most of them having you kill hundreds upon hundreds of enemies until a boss shows up. Kill them, and it's on to the next level.

The difficulty is fairly balanced. Some quests the enemies kill you in one hit, some you kill them in one hit, but I certainly wouldn't label this game "hard" by any means. As long as you are within 5-10 levels of the recommended level for each quest, you should be good. It's also pretty easy to level up, usually growing 3-4 each quest.

A new feature in this game is the girls clothes ripping, which is obviously fan service, but I liked it because it truly added a nice touch to the action. Fighting hordes of monsters felt more gripping and satisfying when your clothes get shredded, and at the end, when you character does her little victory pose, seeing her in shredded clothes just screams "yeah, I just went through Hell, and came out on top!"

Overall, it's not a great game, but it's not bad either. Well worth the very cheap price when it goes on sale in any case.

But again, if you don't like those arena hack'n'slash type games with repetitive gameplay, this isn't for you...at all.

97064048.review:
Hyperdimension Action Neptunia Unleash, es un Spin Off de la saga Hyperdimension Neptunia, por supuesto no es un Re;Birth, así que no nos encontraremos con una obra magnifica, pero... entretiene, además de ser un poquito picante :P.

Todo el juego es a base de misiones, tu objetivo: hacer misiones principales, secundarias y "especiales" a través de las cuales veras la historia principal y algunos eventos, también podrás conseguir medallas, matando monstruos en las misiones con las que conseguirás objetos y power ups para tus atributos, además conseguiremos ropa y accesorios de vestuario para nuestras protagonistas.

La gráfica es estilo anime y no se ve nada mal, la banda sonora no es mala aunque puede hacerse un poco repetitiva.

Como es costumbre en Idea Factory, su juego esta completamente en Ingles, pero gracias al Equipo de Hypertraducciones, tenemos un parche en Español, os dejo el enlace a la Guía de Steam para el parche:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2513573195

Y nada más que decir, compradlo y disfrutadlo, como he dicho no es nada del otro mundo, pero para echarse unas partidas de vez en cuando hasta acabarlo es perfecto.

91215338.review:
[h1]Rating[/h1]
6/10

[h1] Intro [/h1]
After fully completing this game, I had this feeling of uncertainty if I should recommend it. Since there were lots of ups and downs throughout it. But then I'm reminded, that there are other games that are just not enjoyable in every aspect. Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed is not one of those games by any means. Just be ready for an MMORPG-like experience though, seeing as it took me 50+ hours to get everything (if you want to get everything that is).

[h1] Positives [/h1]
+ English dub is underrated.
+ Plenty of content to play and unlock.
+ Sonic the Hedgehog quality soundtrack.
+ Combat is satisfying and rewarding when utilized correctly.
+ Story is funnily written and is not canon to the Re;birth games. Meaning you don't have to play those if you want to enjoy the story in this one.

[h1] Negatives [/h1]
- Grind is not for everyone.
- Some players may not enjoy the fact that certain cut-scenes are long.
- Last level of Neptral Tower is almost impossible without activating the unlockable in-game cheats.
- Mystery quests require you to enter the quest, quit it and then re-enter it to find out what you have to do to clear those quests. So why have them there to begin with?

90526476.review:
Another Neptunia game finished!! Well, still need to grind tower, lily rank for a few more achievements but I will get there eventually. 

This one is about 15 hours for story, 1 hour for gauntlet and another 8 hours of other grinding. So, it’s definitely the shortest neptunia game yet. We been steadily getting about 1-2 neptunia games per year and it seems idea factory is working with multiple partners to create neptunia game in just about every genre. 

This one is button mashing hack and slash with CPU team and Candidate team + 2 new character. There are no IF，Compa or Tome Girl as playable character and there are no Plutia and Pershy. 

Music, Interface, Voice, Jokes are still neptunia like so it’s all pretty good. Difficulty wise is actually really easy and there are built in cheat to help you once you finish the game. (you don’t need it or at least I don’t need it). 

There are only one boss and the entire game is a very repetitive button mashing grind. The DLC gave a few extra quests and it’s really not that significant only add a bit of a challenge it’s both really cheap so if you got extra money, might as well buy and support the developer so we can get more nep nep.

Only going to give it 7/10 for this one. Even through I love Nep Nep this game is too simple and basic for both story and difficulty to get higher score. Recommend for players of all ages but it’s certainly one of the worst neptunia game we have on steam.

PS: This is also the only Neptunia game that I played that character actually have cloth rip built in soooo..... maybe 8/10.

Phew. Waiting till I 100%ed the game to leave a review took way too long...
Anyway, the game in itself is awfully tiny, practically all the playtime comes from the achievements alone, particularly lily rank. I wanted to 100% all the Neptunia games I have, simply because I really like Neptunia, especially more so after the glorious story that was Megadimension Neptunia VII.
Of all Neptunia games, I suppose I'd rank this and the Blanc one the lowest. May not entirely be the game's fault, as many tout this as an inferior Senran Kagura game, and even Senran Kagura has a few neat concepts, but the gameplay itself, I'm not really fond of. Regardless, this game was a pain. Motivation to finish it dropped even further when I got this strange bug where the audio is permanently dead. Verifying game files didn't work, and I for one was too uninterested in uninstalling and reinstalling a game I'd uninstall anyway when I was done, so put up with it.

Lame gameplay, no challenging achievements, just boring(Some missions suck too, like the one where you have to kill 1500 monsters or something. They spawn so damn slowly too). The beginning seemed funny enough with the story intro, but the story really got nowhere at all, and the humour that I sorta enjoy in most Nep games, I didn't in this one. 
Even for a fellow Neptunia fan, this one's a hard pass. I wouldn't recommend it even if it was at a 90% off. Just not worth playing.

78497989.review:
Un buen juego, diferente a lo que estamos acostumbrados respecto a la Saga Neptunia (es un Hack'n'Slash)
El juego es divertido, sin embargo, a medida que se avanza en la historia se vuelve reiterativo.
El sistema de progresión de personajes se basa en eliminar enemigos, dependiendo del tipo se acumulan monedas que son necesarias para canjearlas por armas, items o mejoras de stats permanentes. No son difíciles de conseguir en su mayoría y esto aporta una necesidad de farmear para lograr progresar en escenarios, donde no solamente se depende del lvl que tengan tus personajes.
Con una dificultad aceptable, la que en muchos escenarios no supone una mayor dificultad. Diría que lo mas complejo sería querer terminar las misiones de lvl mas alto, puesto que con uno o dos golpes pueden dejar KO a tu personaje.
De mi parte recomendado el juego, sirve muy bien para cubrir varias horas de diversión, además de contar con otros minijuegos una vez terminada la historia principal, que aportan mas contenido y horas de diversión.

77307271.review:
[b]Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed[/b] is a non-canon spin-off and essentially a Senran Kagura reskin with Neptunia characters. Runs on the same engine as [url=store.steampowered.com/app/411830]Senran Kagura: Shinovi Versus[/url]. Very shallow but enjoyable if you're a fan of both Neptunia and Senran Kagura games (the two series have a lot of overlap in their fanbases).

Compared to Senran Kagura games:
- No blocking/parrying, no target lock, no sprinting, no frantic mode.
- No aerial raves, but some combos let you juggle enemies for a bit.
- No exploration, enemies just endlessly spawn around you until you kill a certain amount/the boss.
- All enemies are asset flips from mainline Neptunia games, and their movesets don't make sense in a beat 'em up game.

On Neptunia's side of things:
- 10 playable characters, 4 CPU's, 4 CPU candidates, Dengekiko and Famitsu.
- Live2D scenes, all of them fully voiced in both English and Japanese.
- Inventory with weapons, rings and a few outfits to choose from (mostly just palette swaps + swimsuits).

Otherwise, the game is quite similar to Senran Kagura games. HDD transformations act like ninja transformations, skills act like ninpos etc. There's a clothes breaking mechanic, although you can't be stripped completely. You take two characters on a mission and swap between them whenever. The game dumps a LOT of missions on you once you finish the prologue and the bulk of the game is just an endless grind through all these samey missions with very little story in between them, you get a cutscene maybe like once every 10 missions (the cutscenes are good though, the writing is very funny and punchy). While Senran Kagura is not a super technical game, this is even more cut down and barebones, you can essentially stand in place and spam one button as the enemies just spawn around you, and you will win if you have the stats. The whole game boils down to doing the numerous missions in the suggested level up order and making sure all your characters have good stats and gear. Can still be a pretty fun time waster mind you, but this kind of gameplay loop makes more sense on a handheld (this is a Vita game after all).

The game has a couple of minor issues when running on Windows 10 and but they're [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2251074340]easy to fix[/url]. There's also a sequel called [url=store.steampowered.com/app/496810]MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies[/url], and it's a bit more polished, with better mechanics and more characters (but no clothes breaking). I recommend giving both a try if you can grab them on a sale.

68837161.review:
Action Unleashed?

More like Mediocrity Unchained.

Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed is a game created by the same people who brought you Senran Kagura, but for some reason, this game lacks any of the polish of a Senran Kagura game.

This game is a perfect description of me: mostly soulless, boring, and the things it does, others do way better for the same price. This is a game that got Very Positive solely because of the franchise it is so sloppily stapled to. If any other developer were to make something of this calibre, it would get laughed out the door. A tried and true example of "Why spend money to make a good game, when our horny fans will buy it anyway?"

The enemies lack any sort of intelligence, with their sole purpose seemingly to just merge their body with yours in the vain hopes of dealing damage. You'd have to play like a complete idiot and force yourself down to Level 1 with an accessory to give them a fighting chance. I get that this is a Warriors type game, but even other Warriors games don't have infantry that are this incompetent at doing their one, sole job. The enemies in this game are so magnetised to the player character, that sometimes, they forget how to go around obstacles, it's like their pathfinding system was designed by someone who only knew how to draw a straight line.

And when the game does provide difficulty, it's so cheap. Get the enemies to 200 levels higher than the level cap? Check. Bloat enemy health to the point where it takes forever to kill them? Check. Have them deal lots of damage in one hit that you can't see coming because of the amount of enemies thrown at you at once? Check. These problems are prevalent and compunded in the stupid 1 dollar DLC they had the audacity to include. Even on sale, the DLC isn't worth it, and that's something I never thought I'd say about a DLC that costs the same as a can of soda. I beat the DLC quests, by the way, but do I feel fulfilled? Do I feel the same thing I feel when overcoming insurmountable odds in other, much better designed games? No.

They make this whole show of the clothes break mechanic, and how it's supposed to make you stronger whilst making you more vulnerable to damage, but it's really just a thinly veiled attempt to give this game depth, as if they suddenly started caring about the game.

The levels are ripped straight out of the PS3 and Re;Birth games with no real effort to tailor them to an action-oriented game, aside from putting some stupid barrier that prevents you from getting out of the immediate area you spawn in. They quite literally lock you into a box to fight some boring enemies, and then once the game decides you've killed enough, they mercifully let you into another box where you do the same thing again. And sometimes, they don't even do that. Sometimes you just stay in that one specific part of the larger dungeon and have you do the entire mission there. You can tell they really just wanted to phone it in - an astounding lack of passion and effort that is honestly almost on par with the annual EA sports games.

I won't even talk about the story because it's about as forgettable a piece of blank paper I put back into a drawer some time ago, and even then I can still remember the vaguely phallic shaped creases on that paper. At the very least, the entire game is voice acted in English, and the writing for the banter between characters is alright. But that's it, really, the only good things about this game don't even pertain to what's arguably the most important aspect of a video game - the gameplay.



All in all, there's almost nothing positive to say about this game. It sells on its name alone. It is reviewed well solely because of its name. If anyone else made something like this, it would get ripped apart. It's a shame, really. Because now Compile Heart and Idea Factory don't have any reason to try anymore. They can just keep releasing mediocre games and they'll still profit. In fact, the very next action game in the Neptunia series is an example of that very fact. MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is pretty much the same level of boring as this game is, and that game sold and reviewed well too.

Don't even buy this game on a sale. Just get some poor schmuck to buy it for you. Your money is better spent on good indie games that actually deserve it.

68765012.review:
Hyperdimension Neptunia Action Unleashed is a spin off title to the hyperdimension franchise. The game plays like a dynasty warriors game where you fight hordes of enemies till you reach some sort of completion requirement. Before I get too ahead of this review let me state that I will be reviewing the game in a pro/ con style and end with my conclusion.

Pro:
     The story is very short. Now that can be a problem when it comes to an RPG game but since it is so short the story can be less deep and can be fun from time to time. The characters are nice to hear their dialogue. Some side missions do provide some background plot to the main story but these are more character driven so they dont hold much weight. So if you in for the gameplay and dont want a heavy story to weight down the experience then this is a positive for you....else you will be a bit disappointed.

Con:
        The clothes ripping mechanic is interesting. So if your clothes rip it boosts your exe bar. I also felt that you attack is stronger much like you would see in senran kagura games. Now it isnt a huge selling point for this game and this mechanic is used as a gemick and hold no other significance than fan service.

       The maps are dull. I get it is a ps vita title but this game seriously reeks of indie slack. Now there are good indie games so this comment is not meant to belittle the devs that put in a bunch of effort to make a solid game regardless of limitations. This game has a limit of what feels like 5 maps. You will be going to these 5 maps through the whole game. It just makes for a visually dull experience when you go to the next mission and see you need to go to the block world or the slime park.

        There is a small limit of enemy variety. Sure there is maybe 15 or 20 enemies around but for a game that you will be visiting the same locations again it would be nice to spice up the enemy variety some. You will see the same enemy periodically through the game which to some is not too bad since they have medals to collect. Enemies drop medals which is used to unlock new equipment or stat boosts. Having more enemies would mean they will need to decrease the amount of medals required to get all the tier rewards which would be good. Also would provide a little more visual interest in a dull world design.

       Missions are very cookie cutter. So the completion request for many missions are to kill a specific enemy or kill a specific total amount of enemies. Now sometimes that number of enemies you need to kill to trigger the specific quest enemy to spawn can be a lot and that ties in to both having repetitive enemies flooding the game and dull arenas. It just leads to playing and beating the game to be a test of stamina and sanity.

       This game has major slowdown. Now I dont believe it is mainly hardware issue but I think it is something to do with the engine used in creating this game or just being a shotty port. When their is many enemies in the map the game chugs frame rates some like being in the matrix or if enemies are attacking it causes the frames to dip. It is just not a fun time to be had to enjoying the game a bit to see the game run at power point frames when you see like 40 enemies on screen at a time which is how the game is initially designed.

        Lilly ranks are a joke. One cool thing is that leveling up lilly ranks do not do much besides some minor buffs like fast sp gain, respawn, ect. There is a lack of unique nature like how the mainline neptunia games had where lilly ranks granted unique bonuses to the character they are attached to. Now it doesnt need to be levels of deep where it unlocks special moves but the bonuses should be different than the same exact bonus regardless of who you boost lilly ranks with. Not to mention I had to make a hotkey program to help boost all my lilly ranks by letting the game play itself. If grinding a core mechanic is dull than it is a faulty mechanic.

Conclusion:
         Neptunia u is not a great game. It was pretty difficult to come up with a single positive thing to say about this game. The game felt dull and the grind for both exp and lilly, especially lilly was a huge chore to do. The slow down just made the game a horrible experience. I guess I should say I hope blanc + neptune vs zombies is good since it is similar since that game looks to be like a dynasty warriors like game. Not much is left to be said than I can not recommend this game.

67257545.review:
Review after 4 hours of play

While Neptunia Rebirth 2 is an improvement over Neptunia Rebirth 1 in terms of writing, the gameplay is identical to the first game and I've heard Rebirth 3 is also the same, and I just can't play this game 3 times right now even if I enjoy it. I decided to simply skip ahead to the later titles, since I have them all, where the gameplay had changed.

Neptunia U Action Unleashed is extremely faithful to the feel of the rest of the series despite being in an entire different genre. The main and most notable new addition however is the most gratuitous examples of fanservice in the series yet. As I've mentioned before, despite its appearances the Neptunia series is actually very light on fanservice. The most you will get is characters wearing less but not doing anything sexual whatsoever which I can't see as anything beyond tricking boys into playing dressup. The characters also behave in an androgynous way where if you changed the character model to a male character model the dialog wouldn't even need to be changed, except when the conversations are explicit in talking about their boob sizes (not as frequent as the number of conversations about this subject in the anime which from what i've seen is exclusively made up of jokes about Blanc's flat chest). Action U however changes this with the new Clothes Explosion Mechanic (I made this name up myself) where the character clothes explode indicating they have filled an off screen bar which allows the Neps to power up into their HDD modes. This way there is less visual clutter in the user interface. There is no way you could possibly not notice the absence of clothing.

The more I play of this series which is a comedy the more I wonder if the jokes are really as simple as they appear or if they are so obtuse I don't even recognize them as jokes. For example it occurred to me the arrangement of characters during dialog scenes could be important and I've been trying to decode the Lily System ever since. During dialog scenes some characters are in the foreground and some are in the background and this is reflected in the dialog as in the characters in the foreground change a bit depending on who is standing behind them. Like I'm not even sure how funny this is yet, is it only a little bit funny or is it hilarious?

As for the gameplay well. The amount of screentime in other Neptunia games between the dialog and the actual game is about even, if you really want to get everything in the game you'll spend a lot more time grinding areas for item drops but if you only want to finish the game you will spend about the same amount of time on dialog as on playing the game. In Action U bizarrely enough I've spent a LOT more time reading dialog compared to playing the game. The levels are short and simple even compared to the rest of the series. The difficulty is very easy if you are playing the standard way but can be unfairly difficult if you play higher level quests first. Only unfairly difficult not impossible.

There are a lot of quirks to the different characters like for example Uni is very difficult to play as because most of her combos end in launching a single enemy into the air which is completely useless for crowd control and makes the pacing grind to a hault as each level takes approximately 100000x longer if you are launching every single enemy. I'm sure there's some upside to this character?

Right anyways. Exploding clothes Ice Climbers fan service. How do you feel about this?
I feel nothing

61155329.review:
Let me clearly say this. Even though I love the Neptunia franchise I really dislike this game (to clarify things I finished the game and even did some of the post game stuff).
With the new fighting system there could have been a lot new fun things that they could have experience with but sadly the game didn't do much with it. But whatever let's just go over the good and bad points.

[b]Let's start with the positives first:[/b]
- New fighting mechanics (even though it was strange at first it fits the game)
- The slice of life scenes were nice to see especially without too much drama
- Nostalgic tracks / maps from the earlier rebirth episodes

[b]But here comes the important negative parts: [/b]
- The quests were repetative (yes I know this is a Neptunia game) but still quests like "Defeat 2500 enemies" is pushing a bit. And even in normal quests you have to defeat 500 enemies before the boss shows up.
- The translation makes some of the girls unbearably annoying (even a simple greeting got translated to 3-4 sentences of gibberish)
- The dialogues between the characters in the lily menu has no subtitles (so good luck without understanding Japanese)
- The game tells you to switch skills in the menu. You are going to get more than 3 skills after you beat the game. So in fact you don't have to do that at all if you are not into post game stuff.
- The last boss of the game was just there to be there. There was no story about her and she had no motive at all. In fact you only met her twice.

So even though I really like the Neptunia series I can't recommand the game if you are not into hack and slash and do not care about story too much. Oh and you should also have perseverance to beat through thousands of monsters in the quests. I would suggest you to try yourself at another Neptunia game instead.

54805166.review:
Neptunia U: Action Unleashed more like Fanservice Unleashed. Unlimited costume breaks for 10 Euro is a bargain.

[i] tldr [/i]: If you're a HDN fan, you should totally try Neptunia U and I think you'll have fun with it.
To be honest, I was expecting less from a spin-off and I was wrong. I liked the game a lot and had a lot of fun. It has it's ups and downs and I'll quickly go over them.
  + New Characters (very kawaii)
The plot is basically the CPUs go around killing monsters while two Gamindustri Journalists (cute girls) were watching and then writing articles about them. These girls made a really good addition to the main cast. Dengekiko is actually the best girl of Neptunia U and I don't wanna hear anything else. I just like Misaka and I also like references.
  + CPUs Unleashed
You can play as any of the CPUs or Sisters and they all have their own skills, animations and weapons which is really cool. In addition to that, there's like a gajillion accessories you can unlock and pick your equipment to suit your play style.
  + Questing
There are a lot of quests in the game and most of them are interesting. In addition to typical quests, there's different challenges, so it has more variety than just "kill them or whatever". Also, by completing quests you can watch special sister bonding time events and that's a wholesome thing.

  - The "most boring antagonist" award won't go to Arfy?
I like all the Neptunia antagonists but IF really missed this time.
[spoiler]I hate the villains that are evil just for the sake of being evil. Like they just try to feck up your day for no other reason but to be a menace to society. That's the antagonist of Action Unleashed for you. Well, maybe I just don't get them. [/spoiler] 
  - I love all Neptunia openings
IF used a different video format for the intro and the opening and, even though I fiddled with my codecs for a while, it wasn't fixed and I didn't get to see the opening. Liked the song though.
  - PS controller support more like go buy another controller
The game didn't register my DS3 controller fsr and I had to install x360ce for it to work. It was a major pain in the a*s and I didn't like it.
  - Oh my God, achievements
There's a lot of achievements in the game. Most of them are fine and you can passively get them by playing the main story, and some of them are the E P I T O M E of tediousness. These are the personal hell for completionists.
That's the major points of my experience and I think that positives are greater than negatives in this one, so I recommend it. 6.9/10, would costume break again.

Un spin-off hack'n'slash basado en los personajes y el mundo de los juegos principales. 

Debo confesar que no me suelen gustar los juegos de este género y que el único motivo por el que he decidido probar este es por pertenecer a la saga. Y no me he arrepentido.
Tiene todo lo que se puede esperar del género: Combos largos y absurdos, enemigos que hacen poco más que decorar, dificultad extrañamente repartida... Y sin embargo añade algunos elementos más característicos de los RPG como subir de nivel, utilizar diferentes equipamientos o cambiar las habilidades del personaje.

La historia, como ya es común en la saga es tremendamente sencilla. Y además el juego es bastante corto (Sin perder el tiempo con nada secundario y haciendo solo la quest principal lo habrás terminado en menos de 10 horas) Sin embargo tiene una cantidad decente de contenido post-game que vale la pena jugar.

En conclusión: Si te gustan los juegos de este género te gustará, y si no te gustan pero eres fan de la saga tal vez puedas darle una oportunidad.

Only annoyance with this game is that there tends to be a little bit too much dialogue at times, but if you have enough patience to sit through the lengthy dialogue, you will find that this game is quite enjoyable. The game is overall not very difficult, but then again, it is probably a good thing that this game isn't too difficult because if it was, then it wouldn't be enjoyable.

Protip: If you are unable to beat the enemies in a particular level or mission, try playing missions that require a lower Recommended Level to level up your characters, so that your characters become strong enough to beat mandatory missions to progress the story.

That is all I have to say about this game.

Neptunia U feels more like a mini-game: complete quests with button mash to defeat everything on the map!
Get this game when it's on sale!
 
It's a good option if you just want some quick button mash with Neptunia characters or if you just want to kill time without thinking too much.
Gameplay is fine and fun to play, but it's very repetitive. You play over the same maps and defeat the same enemies multiple times and the animations/attacks are all the same. 
Don't expect any progressing or story in this game, they are non-existent.

If you want something similar but better, get Blanc vs Zombies. It has a good story and the combat is more refined than Nep U.

About the port:
-Nice graphics for a Vita port. The game is locked at 720p60 and then upscaled, it can't go higher than 1080p60 on settings. Smooth framerate, I didn't notice any drops.
-No bugs or crashes. The only issue I have is that the intro video is all black with only audio when playing with nvidia GPU, I can skip it and keep playing without any problems.
-The 2D assets are very low resolution, even lower than ReBirth 1.

The game is actually quite good, the stoey is not as engaging as the main series or even as some of the other spin offs like Cyperdimention or Sega Hard Girls but it is fun and allows for more of the Neptuna hummor to come through which is always a huge attraction point for these games.

This game is really fun to play so I recomend any fan of Nep Nep to play

47815385.review:
Juego de Hyperdimension Neptunia de los creadores de Senran Kagura, simplemente un Beat´em Up de movimiento libre en 3D (o un machacabotones infinito hasta que el mando no funcione más xD), bastante entretenido con multitud de personajes con buenas diferencias entre sí, muchas misiones y algunas con objetivos más allá de simplemente matar a todo el mundo, aunque la gran mayoría de las misiones son repetitivas al igual que pasa con senran kagura no aburre y entreteniene machacar botones con espectaculares movimientos y técnicas muy épicas, gráficamente bastante decente considerando que es un juego de PsVita y funciona sin problemas a 60fps y 900p en mi equipo de baja gama, una vez más admirando lo fácil que reconoce mi mando génerico para PC cosa que muchos juegos deberían tener, me lo reconoce como si un mando de XONE/X360 se tratase, tiene buen contenido para exprimir tanto para sus logros como para pasarlo bien con su historia, aunque el argumento de la misma es relleno aquí lo principal es darse a golpes con todo el que se mueva, no tiene la misma calidad de un senran kagura pero es divertido y en ofertas se puede comprar a 3-4$ precio bastante bueno para la buena cantidad de contenido que tiene.

Nota final: 6.5/10 simple pero divertido, bonito gráficamente pero sin ser nada de otro mundo, buena optimización y reconoce mando génerico sin problemas, buena cantidad de contenido durando desde las 15 a 30 horas o más si quieres exprimirlo al 100%, recomendado comprarlo en ofertas

47632997.review:
Welcome! Clearly you brought, or are considering, this game because you need/needed more nep-nep in your life. This time around we are treated to an hack'n'slash action game instead of the normal JRPG turn based combat, which is a nice change of pace for anyone who is a veteran of the series and own all the other titles. 

-The combat is simple to pickup, you will be slaying mobs in the thousands in no time. I do recommend a controller for the best experience.... 
-The story is... Well... There really isn't one, but there are still plenty of cutscenes with the humour and dialogue we have come to know and love at this point. For those who don't know... It's just incredibly cheesy... 
-The gameplay is satisfying, not much else to say there really. If you enjoy the hack'n'slash style, you will enjoy this. It does get harder later on too, so there is a bit of challenge to be had, but your mileage may vary...
-All the characters play slightly different from one another, which is nice variety, but I will say some are far better than others... I mean from my experience so far Ram and Nepgear seem incredibly powerful, while others like Blanc feel weak...
-The dress break is a surprise addition, one that even the characters in the game are shocked to find the devs added (literally). So yeah if you want to see your favourite character in panties, let them get hit a bunch and enjoy.
 
Overall it's pretty solid. There are some issues here and there, but it's nothing that ruins the game at all. Get it now or wait for a sale! If you are a fan of the series, you will not be dissapointed...

45906222.review:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U Action Unleashed 

is a spin off of the Neptunia series. Instead of a JRPG this time around it's a Hack and Slash with visual novel elements.It was a nice change of pace this time around and gives you a bit of a break from the normal take turn battle system. It is fairly easy to jump into The controls are easy enough to use thou i do recommend using a controller. The combat is easy to handle thou it does get a bit harder on some of the higher level quest. The story this time around ehh well....there not to much of a story here sadly.This is more of a scenario that takes place due to becoming the most powerful in all of Game Industry. Simply put what could have happened as a continuing of Hyperdimension Neptunia Re Birth 1 true ending.

Over all the game is well done it still has the humor from the the other games in the series. Thou i do have to say that getting your lilly ranks all up to 10 for all the girls is just torture. You will easily spend 5-6 hours doing just that alone. Also if you have not played any of the Neptuina games and are not sure witch one to start with then it is highly recommend you start with Hyperdimension Neptunia Re Birth 1. As it does a good job of introducing to the game world and its characters.

As for my Rating of the Game I would give it a 7/10

43413500.review:
This game is extremely repetative and simple, but sometimes you're looking for something to waste time in while watching a show or talking on discord or whatever.

Choose two of a handful of characters and button mash your way to victory in "quests", which are basically single rooms with constantly spawning enemies you have to slay hundreds of.

Not many equipment or costume options to unlock, but leveling is surprisingly easy.

The difficulty is hit or miss sometimes, but you're usually 10+ levels above the quest you're doing so it tends to not matter.

I got this game for less than 5$ and it was definitely worth it, but I don't think its worth the 30$ full price.

[h1]Update: (7/27/2018)[/h1]
Right... I've made it to chapter 3 so far, but... my thoughts on the game remain the same, with a few slight changes. First off, there's the quests. Personally, I have found these to be quite fun, and interesting, and there are some quests with some... interesting objectives. Secondly: I've gotten used to the banter between characters, along with the idea of combos in hack-n-slash titles. When I first started playing this, I was just mashing buttons. Eventually I looked at the combo list and found that I had to actually pay attention to which buttons I'm pressing... (then again, that much is a given, but I'm relatively new to hack-n-slash titles... not entirely, but somewhat, so I was kind of just learning the ropes, much like any other genre or title I have played maybe a couple of times before). Because I consider these to be slight changes in opinion, my review score isn't changing. 

[h1]Disclaimer[/h1]
I still consider myself terrible at writing reviews. I may have improved slightly from when I first started reviewing titles on Steam, however this doesn't mean I'm completely blind to the fact that there's still room for improvement. That being said, take this info with a grain of salt. There's a fine difference between reading a review, watching someone play a game, and actually trying it out for yourself. On that note: if you find that the game isn't quite to your liking: Valve has a system in place for refunds for that very reason.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
With more fourth wall breaking than ever before, comes another Neptunia title from Idea Factory. Note that this is solely based on my opinions of the game, from the amount of time I've spent playing the game so far, and thus does not reflect my final opinion of the game as a whole. So, without further adieu, let's get this show on the road!

Going with a different format for my reviews this time, I'll start off with the gameplay:

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The gameplay is reminiscent of entries in the Dynasty Warriors franchise (though, to be fair, I haven't played a SINGLE Dynasty Warriors title, I'm not entirely new to the Hack-N'-Slash genre, as I have played Hyrule Warriors at one point.) Despite the venture into a different genre in comparison to the other Neptunia titles, such as the 3 remakes, and Megadimension Neptunia VII, it doesn't lose its charm; its appeal. The lines get a bit repetitive after a while, but... honestly, I'm COMPLETELY fine with that.  Speaking of, this brings me to the next topic.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
So... this may come off as a bit of an unpopular opinion, but personally, I don't really care about graphics too much. Say what you will, I'm perfectly fine with games running at lower resolutions than most triple A games, and 30 FPS. When I see people saying stuff like "30 FPS is unplayable", I just roll my eyes and move on. As long as a game doesn't run like a flipping slideshow, I'm completely fine with that. As per my motto: "If a game isn't fun, what's the point of having amazing visuals?!". My personal opinions aside, there are some fixable issues such as blurred images from upscaling the resolution (which, again, I didn't really mind because the game was at least fun enough (to me anyways) for me to endure it). 

[h1]Music[/h1]
As per usual with Neptunia games, the music goes for a more... sort of remixed retro style approach from what I've heard so far, with a bit of a modern twist. The music matches the environments rather well, might I add. Will have to play some more to hear what the rest of the soundtrack has to offer.

[h1]Story[/h1]
This is where we get into the slightly spoilerific territory... or not, cause I literally only made it through 1 chapter so far. The game starts off with Dengekiko asking to write a article about the CPUs: Neptune, Vert, Blanc, and Noire, and Famitsu writing an article on the CPU Candidates: Nepgear, Uni, Rom, and Ram. The dialogue actually fits this narrative rather well, though there are some.... quotable moments here and there, as per the usual (from what I've noticed out of the 4 nep games I've played thus far.

[h1]Closing remarks[/h1]
While I enjoyed playing the game, I've only played it for a short amount of time. That being said, I'm bound to update this review once I playthrough a bit more of the game. I understand it can be considered a lazy practice as I've used this for my playthroughs of Outlast and MGS V: Ground Zeroes (though I really should get around to finishing those games one of these days). On that note: I give this game a (partial) review score of: 9/10.

[h1]Scorecard[/h1]
[list][*]Gameplay: 10
[*]Visuals: 8
[*]Music: 10
[*]Story: 8
[/list]

42203102.review:
[h1] Hyperdimension Neptunia U [/h1]

[b] [u] As far as i know, sexual content and nudity is heavily expexted, so lets skip that point first [/u] [/b]

By contrast, i can not say this is a bad game from the entire series, and definitely [i]NOT[/i] the best of them.

[b] Story/Overview [/b]

So, how do we start... hmmm

I know this is a non-canonical series but still you can expect some classic Neptunia comedy here. The concept of making the game funny and comedy-driven story is just great, and to be fair, this is the first time i laughed hard just by looking at the conversation for no reason. I know Neptune is just a stupid girl talking for no plot, but this is another point of this game. The overall story is [u]Meh[/u], meaning that don't ever expect great storyline as the Re;1 or VII has, the setting still the same though, you play as one of the character, but this time they remove some side-character and adding non-playable character from the older game instead. Only that its now hack 'n slash so it would be a bit different point of view to see how the character itself fight or just making a move in the battlefield.

[b] Game Mechanics [/b]

With a brand new hack 'n slash game mode, this is just getting interesting. The rest of the mechanic game system remain uncanged, like the equipments or the accessories itself, but the only different is that you can only change them while in the main menu instead of instantly change your items while in battlefield, due to the hack 'n slash mode of course. Nevertheless, the rest is just same, you got a similiar main menu, similiar maps system, customizable characters, new [i]Costume Break[/i] mechanics, quest is a little bit different but still has the same mechanics, [u]and you can now change the music from the main sequence, fancy right ?[/u]. Besides of it all, i do love the combat system where you can hack 'n slash merely all of the enemy horde in front of you, many characters can just spam the attack all the way on and many of them are just focused on single heavy shot of damage. Just be careful not to shreds off your costume while rushing them all.

[b] Gameplay [/b]

I love the entire gameplay, no comments on this one. If you okay with the original title you'll love this one, altough if you don't fit with the nudity content i can't really say this game was okay.

[b] Music [/b]

Unlike older series, Neptunia U doesnt really get me deeper into its music library since its just a library of many previous game, altough its still good to listen to, nothing fresh out of it. The Opening Song is still [strike]Trash[/strike] for me but hell yeah this is the first time i love the Ending Song they put into it, its just fit the ED so much that i wanted to replay them so many times after i heard them in the first place.

[b] Graphics [/b]

The graphic is the fatal issue when i discovered them. The resolutions are just so unspecific. There are many fixes that you can do but i still dont know how it work. First, the original resolution is crappy and doesnt fit anyhow. Second, fullscreen means that the game will go to the maximum resolution of your screen, despite that the in-game settings states is just 720p or lower it will just maximize itself. And just my personal advice, try to upscale the game by using Custom resolution on your desktop, i've tried on lower resolution monitor (768p) and the graphics is just like a pixelated games due to a really weird port method they invented from PSVITA to this PC version. Trying to upsacle the game to 2K on my older monitor seems fix the issues altough you cant see those enemy healthbar clearly anymore.

[b] Characters and Voice Actors [/b]

Overall, im really enjoying the game with no voice-cut like the original series has where it shows just the character and dialogue with no voice in it, but this one got nothing to deal with them. Mainly because the story is too short, all dialogue can contains voice (even with the ending dialogue where non playable characters just slide in and made some announcement), fully appreciate them and i like to see more on newer series, it can bring up the games more lively and basically, better. Character is still progressing and you can actually see that this is a representation of Re;1 and Re;2 character development with the same main character playing around with their sisters.

[b] Overall/Extraordinary Contents [/b]

Finally, time to talk about the [spoiler]Senran Kagura[/spoiler] game mechanics. I dont really know why they put this idea into the original Hyperdimension series but heck yeah many people love it so,,, i guess its not really bad idea. From my point of view, the adult content is okay. Nothing more than ripped off clothes and nude girl here and there, its kinda lame to see how the mechanics goes on and on like hell but still, they care about fanservice here. Luckily you can, like YOU can use unbreakable outfit so there's no more nudity here and there [spoiler]you can earn them through the storyline[/spoiler]. Overall, this spin-off game is fully enjoyable, meaning that [i]adult content aside[/i] this worth the bucks very well, the game itself is fun to play, and if you're looking for hack 'n slash game with small adult content you can just buy this game anyway, but make sure to buy it when its on sale xD

41159270.review:
This is a brawler game set in the Neptunia universe. How does it stack against other specimens of the genre, such as Devil May Cry or Darksiders? Poorly. There are few moves available and there is - overall - very little depth to the gameplay. There is some token story but it seems even less important than what I remember from Re;Birth1. Difficulty is not adjustable, and the game is really, [i]really[/i] easy. And then there are DLC weapons to use... There are no random achievements, but one of them takes several (5-ish) hours of dedicated grinding! The NG+ content is plain bad, other than the built-in cheats... but that's not exactly content. I tried the English dub for a moment and it is drop dead terrible (and I'm guessing other games from the series are like that as well). Luckily you can switch to Japanese audio. You miss out on some interactions (the Lily dialogs between characters) but that's still a lesser evil.

It might sound like there are only negatives so far, but I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy it. Somehow I did. It's probably the easygoing setting and characters. But I think that - to be able to appreciate those - you need to have some prior knowledge. Go start with Re;Birth 1 if you know nothing about Neptunia. For fans of the series this game will likely be "good enough", even if it looks like a poorly thought out experiment at times. Also there is a well made nude mode that I can recommend.

39137511.review:
Came for the Neps, stayed for the actual gameplay.
Game is alot of fun. I´ll tell you why.

1.) Gameplay
Gameplay is easy to describe. You have three options to attack. Normal attack, hard attack and your special moves. At some point you can Transform into your HDD form, which makes you stronger. You just have to beat the enemys and / or finish the clear condition. You can´t do anything wrong. No fancy combos (it has combos but I dont want to call them that).

2.) Story
The story is somewhat ok. The usual "Something bad is in town and we have to kill it". I skipped alot of dialogue becuase it was sometimes real annoying. Decide that for yourself how you want to rate it but I assume that you dont play Hack n Slash because of the big storys.

3.) Graphics
It is what you expect from an anime-style game: simple, not much details. I don´t wanna say it´s bad but yee... Let´s keep it at that.

4.) Sound
Musik is great. I really enjoy the music. And the game has alot of music from other Neptunia games.
Soundeffects is a diffrent story. I´d say they´re real annoying after a while, mostly because it just repeats over and over again. Nep Jr. and Uni are the worst when it comes to effect sounds.
Voice acting is like in other Neptunia games really good (my opinion). I also don´t think that you have to use japanese voice for the full experience, english is real nice too.

5.) Controls
Controls are real nice overall. Only two things i didn´t really like:
Camera is absolut terrible. I just hate it.
No native PS4-Controller support. Had to use third-party software to emulate an Xbox controler (DS4 Windows)

6.) Conclusion
I´d say 7/10 if you like the Hack n Slash genre, 4/10 if you´re new to the Neptunia Series.
Got it for ~3€ in the sale. For this price it´s just fine. Would say that 27,99€ (regular price) is way too high considering what you actually get. Sorry Idea Factory but thats just too much.

38995208.review:
Well, for starters -- this is a Neptunia game. If you don't know what that means in terms of setting and characters you should probably look at the main JRPG series first. This is a spinoff which isn't considered canon -- but it could very well be since it's not reshaping Gamindustri in any way.

Also, this is a Neptunia game, using IF's patented(?) technique of asset-reuse. It has considerably less story than the main games (if you can even call it a story -- I haven't finished the game yet). 

On the positive side, the lack of story means fewer visual-novel style dialogues and much less childish brabbling. Compared to Re:Birth3, the visual novel parts are generally better -- all of them are voice acted, there can be more than 2 portraits on screen, and they move around a bit to indicate who's talking.

On the negative side, the lack of story also means considerably less Neptunia humor. The 4th wall is only getting a light beating, and there isn't much in terms of gaming or console references.

Gameplay is nothing special. This is an action game, so it's basically button mashing your light and heavy attacks along with combos thereof, moving around, possibly firing an SP skill every once in a while. You fill an EXE gauge by killing stuff which lets you go into HDD eventually which depletes the gauge over time, or when you fire your EXE skill -- which, contrary to the SP skills, very much feel like "press button to win", especially when you do it for the final boss.

You take 2 characters into battle that you can switch around; other characters do NOT gain experience so you need to use all your characters to level them. There is a Lily system, which provides some passive bonuses. The passive character heals over time, and gains points for EXE  faster.

Characters feel reasonably different, even Rom and Ram (although I do have to admit that I need to fire a heavy attack at the beginning to figure out which of the two I'm playing :-)). You can even "feel" Blancs hammer being heavy compared to the lighter attacks from other characters.

Missions aka quests are basically always of the "kill trashmobs first, then kill boss(es)" type. Locales are familiar, except that they are much more restrictive as the fights are arena-style.

Playable characters are the 4 main CPUs, the candidates, and 2 characters that I think have been created for this game (Dengekiko and Famitsu). As for the main story, no other characters appear, although there are a few "guest" appearances post game.

Talking about postgame, there will be a couple additional quests, and two additional game modes. The Gauntlet is just rubbish, while Neptral Tower is a grindfest of levels to beat.

The upgrade path is tied to medals obtained from monster killing, so depending on how you look at it you don't get much choice, or you can use it to specifically repeat specific missions to gain more medals of a specific type.

Sound is Neptunia. The voice acting is as always, I've heard familiar music tracks, and some that I didn't recgonize (but I haven't played all the main games yet, and I don't necessarily remember all the tracks). I don't know whether there are original tracks,

The game certainly isn't difficult. I found combos to be generally complicated to pull off since it's hard to tell when to press the next button unless there's a signal move like "Hit X until the char dashes, then press Y". But that didn't hurt me at all, and for many characters I'd just spam attacks without paying too much attention to combos at all.

To sum it up, even though the game has been created by a different company, and has different gameplay, Idea Factory has ensured that it IS a Neptunia game through and through.

Although the game is solid enough, I can imagine that there are better games with this kind of gameplay, so the usual caveat applies: if you like to nep-nep your monsters instead of just bashing them, go for it. Maybe wait for a sale, though.
If you can't stand the main Neptunia series, then this game probably won't change your mind.

DON'T BUY THIS GAME.
It is a completely unplayable PC port.
The default keybindings are unusably odd but good luck changing them, since the keybind settings only lists what the controls would be on a gamepad and not their actual function meaning you'd need to write down or memorize all the imputs on a controller just to change them.
Even if you own a controller, don't buy this game.
This isn't the first PC game I've played which required a gamepad, it is however the first one to both require a controller and have a bug that many people experience that means it will simply NOT REGISTER THAT YOU ARE USING A GAMEPAD.
First thing I did after was plug in my Xbox 360 controller, to find that I still could not select the gamepad option in the menu.
I searched the problem and what did I find? DOZENS of topics from people usingall manner of gamepads (So this bug isn't even limited to just a specific type of controller) experiencing the same problem, people using PS4 and Logitech controllers were able to get things to function using a third part program that makes their gamepad function as an Xbox Controller, but those already using an Xbox Controller have had no such luck, literally rendering the game unplayable.
I spent over half an hour trying to get it to work or trying to rebind the keyboard keys to something playable, but I have officially given up, the only reason I'm not requesting a refund is because it seems that reviews are deleted upon recieving one, and I'd prefer to actually warn people about the utter trash that is this port.

38719854.review:
Great game. First off, it's a Hack and slash spinoff variant of the Turn Based JRPG main series, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. That being said, it's more for people who have played the main series, or for anyone who just really loves anime/manga. As the title may suggest, a deep story is most definitely not going to be found here, or anywhere within this franchise. Bear in mind, however, that does not mean the game is bad. On the contrary, actually, that's part of what gives this series, and this game, its charm. Just the random silliness and easy-going atmosphere of the game is enough to suck you in for hours, laughing along with whatever nonsensical shenanigans are going on.

Although very simple in principle, the game proves quite challenging if you just grinded one or two characters out and neglected all the others, as there are certain quests that require certain characters, giving the game a more full feeling than if you could just use the same two characters and beat the game in an hour or two.

The music is characteristic of the series, and the graphics are pretty good as well, even featuring a little improvement. The combat system is centered on combinations, but the different tiers of attacks are pretty parallel to those of the main series, which is comforting if you are new to Hack and Slash games.

All in all, it's pretty good. I'd personally pay full price for it, but that's just because I've been a fan of the series for years. That being said, if this is the first game in the franchise you're buying, either start with the main series, or pick this one up on sale.

8.5/10

I was easily able to get through the stages, even the ones with thousands of enemies. Don't expect this one to have much of a story though, it's a spin-off for a reason.

34389213.review:
Achievements: All possible and easy-- though some require a painful level of grinding.  Through the course of the game, you'll probably have completed roughly 300 missions-- maybe less.  That many missions will have likely unlocked all accessories/gear that the game offers and maxed out every character's level.  The "Lily Lord" achievement requires the beating of an additional ~900 missions or more (45 pairings each requiring around 20 missions to max out).  It's just a bit too much of a grind considering there's nothing else to grind for-- item drops, levels, etc.  

Pros/Cons:
+ Most text is voiced and the voice acting is great.  
+ The artstyle is adorable.  
+ Combat feels pretty fluid and satisfying.
+ The amount of fanservice is adjustable.  
+ There are some fun unlockable abilities/items.
+ Each character feels fairly distinct in terms of combat.

- Every mission is way too alike.  Each quest, with very few exceptions, is essentially 'kill 100+ enemies' or 'kill 100+ enemies then a boss'.  There's no story behind each mission or any unique rewards for completing certain ones.  
- Most missions can be completed by mashing the x button.  There's nothing challenging the player enough to deviate from that strategy.  
- It's common for both characters to be defeated at once since the partner spawns in at the same location the first character just died with no invincibility frames.  
- Though I did get 31 hours out of the game, most of that time was spent achievement grinding.  I'd say, rather generously, that the game's content took me around 10 hours to see.  I don't believe that warrants the $30 pricetag.  
- Though some missions had maps with paths to navigate, the large majority were just simple arenas.  
- Most bosses felt like oversized enemies and could be killed just as simply.  
- It crashed a few times for me.  
- There's no autosave.  

Overall:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed gave me a good first impression.  I was charmed by the sequences of visual novel storytelling, and the combat was fluid and fun.  Sadly, though, the game just fell flat.  It felt as if I was just slaughtering foot soldiers in Dynasty Warriors again and again without any major changes or overarching purpose.  At first, I liked that mindlessness, but, for the price, I wanted more.  I wanted more customization, more story, more challenge, more reasons to keep on grinding.  I was not given these things.  With so many great features like the art and voice acting, Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed had so much potential.  Given its overly simple and repetitive nature, I cannot bring myself to recommend this game.  Perhaps bigger fans of the series can find something to redeem it, but I could not.

34116207.review:
Hyperdimension Neptunia U is the series first attempt at making a hack 'n' slash game. Which is why, it's understandable that there will be many flaws. But is it worth the price? Well, let me tell you my problem with this game: it's very repetitive and boring.

After you try to use all the characters in this game, then you basically already experience everything that this game has to offer. Every level feel the same, enemies including the mid boss offer little to no challange, and the combo is very simple, you could just spam X and win. The objectives is always the same, "kill a certain amount of enemies" or "kill a mid boss, but to summon the mid boss, you must kill a certain amount of enemies first". And when I say a "certain amount of enemies", I'm talking about 100 to 500 enemies. Which mean you must spam the X or Y button to kill that many cannon fodder enemies until you beat the level.

The main story itself is very short and not very interesting. I think I beat the main story at my 9 hours playtime. Just don't expect the story to be like anything you experience in Re;Birth trilogy or Megadimension.

The game highlighted feature is the cloth tearing feature, which basically make your characters cloth rip after a certain amount of hit. Cool feature, sure, but let's be honest, this feature exist only for fanservice and add little to nothing for the gameplay itself

It's the first hack 'n' slash game in Neptunia franchise, so it's not a surprise to see so many flaws. But I would recommend to everyone who's interested in buying this game to either a) wait for sale, or b) buy Megatagmension Blanc + Neptune instead. Megatagmension is more well done, has more characters and online feature as well (though I doubt anyone is still playing online to this day).
